thread.title: Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say
thread.title_full: Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say

author: SALLY HO and BETH HARRIS
title: Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say
text:
Ross D. Franklin Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say 
FILE - In this April 24, 2007, file photo, Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom sits on the bench in the fourth quarter of a Western Conference playoff basketball game against the Phoenix Suns in Phoenix. Odom, who was embraced by teammates and television fans alike for his Everyman approach to fame, was found face-down and alone Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, after spending four days at the Love Ranch, a legal Nevada brothel. (AP Photo/Ross D. Franklin, File) Jeff Lewis Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say 
FILE - In this July 31, 2009, file photo, Los Angeles Lakers' Lamar Odom speaks to the media during a news conference after the Lakers signed Odom to a multi-year NBA basketball contract, in El Segundo, Calif. Odom spent most of his 14-year NBA career in Los Angeles with the Lakers and Clippers, becoming a fan favorite before he sought even more fame with the Kardashians. Odom, who was embraced by teammates and television fans alike for his Everyman approach to fame, was found face-down and alone Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, after spending four days at the Love Ranch, a legal Nevada brothel. (AP Photo/Jeff Lewis, File) Mark J. Terrill Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say 
FILE - In this March 2, 2008, file photo, Los Angeles Lakers forward Lamar Odom reacts to a call during the second half of their NBA basketball game against the Dallas Mavericks, in Los Angeles. Odom spent most of his 14-year NBA career in Los Angeles with the Lakers and Clippers, becoming a fan favorite before he sought even more fame with the Kardashians. Odom, who was embraced by teammates and television fans alike for his Everyman approach to fame, was found face-down and alone Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, after spending four days at the Love Ranch, a legal Nevada brothel.(AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill, File) Posted: Sunday, October 18, 2015 5:30 am | Updated: 6:01 am, Sun Oct 18, 2015. Lamar Odom regains consciousness, family and friends say Associated Press | 
LAS VEGAS (AP) — Family members of Lamar Odom declined to comment on his condition or activities Saturday, a day after he regained consciousness and communicated — speaking and even giving a thumbs-up from his hospital bed — after being found in extremely critical condition at a Nevada brothel. 
Alvina Alston, publicist for JaNean Mercer, Odom's maternal aunt and godmother, would not confirm whether Odom was breathing on his own or communicating more.
